summary: The invalid tier handling was fixed to fail-closed and prevent NaN/Infinity from being cached, with no new blocking issues introduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Tier normalization does not handle NaN/Infinity/non-numeric values, allowing invalid tiers to be cached and returned.
previous_issues_status.notes: The new logic checks for finiteness and fails closed to tier 1, logging the anomaly and preventing invalid values from being cached.
